meanings.definition: Squushes (verb): to crush or squeeze something with force
meanings.sent1: She squushes the grapes to make juice.
meanings.sent2: The toddler squushes the playdough in his hands.
meanings.sent3: The elephant squushes the tiny car with its massive foot.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the books squushes the delicate flower beneath them.
meanings.sent5: The wrestler's powerful grip squushes his opponent into submission.

meanings.definition: Squushes (noun): a sound made when something is crushed or squeezed
meanings.sent1: The squushes of the leaves underfoot filled the forest.
meanings.sent2: The squushes of the ripe tomatoes being picked echoed in the greenhouse.
meanings.sent3: The squushes of the mud as he walked made him giggle.
meanings.sent4: The squushes of the snow under their boots signaled winter's arrival.
meanings.sent5: The squushes of the marshmallows in the s'mores were music to their ears.

meanings.definition: Squushes (adjective): describing something that is soft and easily crushed
meanings.sent1: The squushes pillow sank under his weight.
meanings.sent2: The squushes snowball melted in her hand.
meanings.sent3: The squushes cake collapsed under the weight of the frosting.
meanings.sent4: The squushes sponge soaked up the spilled milk quickly.
meanings.sent5: The squushes marshmallow flattened easily between his fingers.
